requirement_tested: A frontend application that fetches all species biological data from backend APIs
user_persona: A biology student exploring different animal species for a research project.
user_goal: To view a list of species and navigate to detailed information about one.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Maya opens the website to explore the species database. She sees a grid of species cards loaded dynamically.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A responsive grid of species cards is displayed, each showing the common name, scientific name, and conservation status fetched from the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Species Detail
narrative_steps.description: Maya clicks on a species card to learn more about it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a species card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The user is redirected to the species detail page with comprehensive biological information fetched from the backend API.

requirement_tested: A backend API service that connects to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer testing the backend setup.
user_goal: Verify that the backend connects to the database and serves species data.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: Alex starts the backend server after setting up the correct environment variables.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server with environment variables configured.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The server initializes successfully and connects to the PostgreSQL database using the provided credentials.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Species Data
narrative_steps.description: Alex makes a request to the species list endpoint.
narrative_steps.action: Send a GET request to '/api/species'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The API returns a JSON response containing species data retrieved from the connected PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: Database schema design to store species biological information data
user_persona: A database administrator validating the schema.
user_goal: Ensure the species table exists with correct columns and constraints.

narrative_steps.title: Connecting to Database
narrative_steps.description: Sam connects to the PostgreSQL database using admin tools.
narrative_steps.action: Connect to PostgreSQL database with admin credentials.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Successfully connected to the database instance.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Table Structure
narrative_steps.description: Sam queries the database to inspect the schema of the species table.
narrative_steps.action: Run '\d species' or equivalent SQL command.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The table 'species' is found with columns: id, common_name, scientific_name, habitat, diet, conservation_status, and scientific_name has a unique constraint.

requirement_tested: Browse functionality to display lists of species with their biological information
user_persona: A wildlife enthusiast looking to discover new species.
user_goal: Browse through a list of species and view their basic information.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Browse Page
narrative_steps.description: Jordan visits the browse section to see all available species.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the /browse URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A paginated or infinitely scrollable list of species cards is displayed showing common name, scientific name, and brief habitat/diet info.

narrative_steps.title: Loading More Items
narrative_steps.description: Jordan scrolls down to load more species.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll towards the bottom of the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional species cards are loaded dynamically without requiring a page refresh.

requirement_tested: Search functionality allowing users to find specific species or biological data
user_persona: A researcher needing quick access to specific species data.
user_goal: Find a specific species by typing its name into the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Search Query
narrative_steps.description: Taylor types 'Lion' into the search bar located at the top of the page.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'Lion' into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The search input accepts the text and enables submission options.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Search
narrative_steps.description: Taylor presses Enter to submit the search query.
narrative_steps.action: Press Enter key in the search field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page updates to show only species matching the term 'Lion', fetched via the /api/search endpoint.

requirement_tested: Filtering capabilities to narrow down species data based on various criteria
user_persona: An environmental scientist studying endangered animals.
user_goal: Filter species by conservation status to focus on endangered ones.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Filter Panel
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks the filter icon to reveal filtering options.
narrative_steps.action: Click the filter toggle button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The filter control panel slides open, revealing options grouped under collapsible sections.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Conservation Status Filter
narrative_steps.description: Casey selects 'Endangered' from the conservation status checkboxes.
narrative_steps.action: Check the 'Endangered' checkbox under conservation status.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The species list updates instantly to show only those marked as endangered, fetched with updated filter parameters.

requirement_tested: Responsive web design with linen as the base color and maroon for all UI components
user_persona: A UX designer reviewing visual consistency.
user_goal: Confirm that the website uses the correct color scheme and is responsive.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Riley inspects the background color on desktop.
narrative_steps.action: Open DevTools and inspect the body element's background-color.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background color is set to linen (#FAF0E6).

narrative_steps.title: Checking Component Colors
narrative_steps.description: Riley checks the color of interactive elements like buttons.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect a button's color properties.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Button background or border color is maroon (#800000).

narrative_steps.title: Testing Responsiveness
narrative_steps.description: Riley resizes the browser window to simulate mobile viewing.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to mobile dimensions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts appropriately; species cards stack vertically instead of forming a grid.

requirement_tested: Species detail pages displaying comprehensive biological information
user_persona: A nature documentary producer gathering facts about species.
user_goal: View detailed information and images for a selected species.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Detail Page
narrative_steps.description: Jamie navigates to the detail page for a specific species.
narrative_steps.action: Visit /species/123 where 123 is a valid species ID.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page displays full name, photo gallery, habitat, diet, behavior notes, and conservation status in clearly separated sections.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Images in Lightbox
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks an image in the gallery to get a better look.
narrative_steps.action: Click on an image within the gallery.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Image opens in a modal/lightbox view overlaying the current page.

requirement_tested: Pagination or infinite scroll for browsing large datasets
user_persona: A casual visitor browsing many species.
user_goal: Effortlessly browse through a long list of species.

narrative_steps.title: Initial Load
narrative_steps.description: Morgan lands on the browse page and sees the first batch of species.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the /browse page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: First set of species cards is displayed with either pagination controls or scroll-triggered loading mechanism present.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Next Batch
narrative_steps.description: Morgan scrolls near the bottom of the list.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the list of species.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Next batch of species is automatically loaded without clicking anything, maintaining smooth user experience.

requirement_tested: API endpoints for retrieving species data with support for search and filter parameters
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating with backend services.
user_goal: Fetch filtered species data using API calls.

narrative_steps.title: Making Filtered Request
narrative_steps.description: Devon constructs a request to fetch species living in forests with carnivorous diets.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to /api/species?habitat=forest&diet=carnivore.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: API responds with a JSON array of species matching both habitat and diet criteria.

requirement_tested: User interface components for search input and filter controls
user_persona: A regular user exploring the site features.
user_goal: Use search and filter UI elements effectively.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Bailey enters a keyword into the search bar and submits it.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'Elephant' in the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Main content area updates to show species whose names or descriptions contain 'Elephant'.

narrative_steps.title: Toggling Filters
narrative_steps.description: Bailey opens the filter panel to refine results further.
narrative_steps.action: Click the filter toggle icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Filter control panel becomes visible on the left side of the screen.

requirement_tested: Data management capabilities for adding and updating species information
user_persona: An admin user maintaining the species database.
user_goal: Add a new species entry to the database.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Admin Form
narrative_steps.description: Quinn logs in as admin and accesses the add species form.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to /admin/add-species.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A form with fields for common name, scientific name, habitat, diet, and conservation status is displayed.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting New Entry
narrative_steps.description: Quinn fills out the form and saves the new species.
narrative_steps.action: Fill all required fields and click the Submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New species record is created in the database and confirmation message is shown.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for installing frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Dana clones the repo and runs the install script.
narrative_steps.action: Execute 'npm run install:all' in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'dev' script for running frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer starting local development servers.
user_goal: Launch both frontend and backend servers with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Dana wants to start working on the app and runs the dev script.
narrative_steps.action: Execute 'npm run dev' in the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start concurrently, allowing simultaneous development and testing.

requirement_tested: Error handling for database connections and API requests
user_persona: A system administrator monitoring application health.
user_goal: Ensure graceful failure when backend services encounter issues.

narrative_steps.title: Simulating Database Failure
narrative_steps.description: SysAdmin simulates a broken database connection to test error handling.
narrative_steps.action: Shut down the PostgreSQL service temporarily.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend returns a standardized JSON error response indicating database unavailability rather than crashing.

narrative_steps.title: Testing API Error Response
narrative_steps.description: SysAdmin sends an invalid API request to verify error messaging.
narrative_steps.action: Make a malformed GET request to /api/species.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Server returns a clear, user-friendly JSON error message detailing the issue.
